generated_code_tries.code:
# imports
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import json

def scraper(url: str) -> dict:
  # get page content
  page = requests.get(url)

  # create BeautifulSoup object
  soup = BeautifulSoup(page.content, 'html.parser')

  # find all book containers
  books = soup.find_all('article', class_='product_pod')

  # initialize empty list to store book information
  book_data = []

  # loop through each book
  for book in books:
    # extract title
    title = book.find('h3').find('a').get('title')

    # extract star rating
    rating = book.find('p', class_='star-rating').get('class')[1]

    # extract price
    price = float(book.find('p', class_='price_color').text[1:])

    # check if book is in stock
    in_stock = True if book.find('p', class_='instock availability').text.strip() == 'In stock' else False

    # create dictionary for book information
    book_info = {
      'title': title,
      'rating': rating,
      'price': price,
      'in_stock': in_stock
    }

    # append book_info to book_data list
    book_data.append(book_info)

  # convert book_data to JSON and return
  return json.dumps(book_data)

if __name__ == '__main__':
  # dummy url
  url = "https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/category/books/travel_2/index.html"

  # call scraper function and print result
  print(scraper(url))

START CONTEXT

# imports
import bs4 

def scraper(url: str) -> str:
    # create an empty dictionary
    books = []
    
    # make a request to the url using bs4
    source = bs4.BeautifulSoup(requests.get(url).text, 'lxml')
    
    # select the section containing all book information
    books_info = source.find_all('article', class_='product_pod')
    
    # loop through each book information
    for info in books_info:
        # extract title
        title = info.h3.a['title']
        
        # extract rating
        rating = info.p['class'][1]
        
        # extract price
        price = float(info.find('p', class_='price_color').text.strip("£"))
        
        # extract in_stock
        if "In stock" in info.find('p', class_='instock availability').text:
            in_stock = True
        else:
            in_stock = False
            
        # create a dictionary for each book and append to books list
        book = {
            "title": title,
            "rating": rating,
            "price": price, 
            "in_stock": in_stock
        }
        books.append(book)
        
    # print out books list as JSON
    print(json.dumps(books, indent=2))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    url = "https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/category/books/travel_2/index.html"
    scraper(url)

# imports
import bs4 
import json
import requests

def scraper(url: str) -> str:
    # create an empty dictionary
    books = []
    
    # make a request to the url using bs4
    source = bs4.BeautifulSoup(requests.get(url).text, 'lxml')
    
    # select the section containing all book information
    books_info = source.find_all('article', class_='product_pod')
    
    # loop through each book information
    for info in books_info:
        # extract title
        title = info.h3.a['title']
        
        # extract rating
        rating = info.p['class'][1]
        
        # extract price
        try:
            price = float(info.find('p', class_='price_color').text.strip("£").replace("Â",""))
        except ValueError:
            print("Unable to convert price to float for book", title)
        
        # extract in_stock
        if "In stock" in info.find('p', class_='instock availability').text:
            in_stock = True
        else:
            in_stock = False
            
        # create a dictionary for each book and append to books list
        book = {
            "title": title,
            "rating": rating,
            "price": price, 
            "in_stock": in_stock
        }
        books.append(book)
        
    # print out books list as JSON
    print(json.dumps(books, indent=2))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    url = "https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/category/books/travel_2/index.html"
    scraper(url))

# imports
import bs4 
import json
import requests

def scraper(url: str):
  # get webpage content
  res = requests.get(url)
  res.raise_for_status()
  # parse webpage content
  soup = bs4.BeautifulSoup(res.text, "html.parser")
  # create list to store book information
  books = []
  # iterate through each book on the page
  for book in soup.find_all("article", class_="product_pod"):
    # extract title
    title = book.h3.a.get("title")
    # extract rating
    rating = book.p.get("class")[1]
    # extract price
    price = None 
    try:
      price = float(book.find("p", class_="price_color").text.strip("£").replace("Â",""))
    except ValueError:
      print("Unable to convert price to float for book", title)
    # check if book is in stock
    in_stock = book.find("p", class_="instock availability").text.strip() != "In stock"
    # create a dictionary for each book and append to books list
    book = {
      "title": title,
      "rating": rating,
      "price": price, 
      "in_stock": in_stock
    }
    books.append(book)
  # print out list of books in JSON format
  print(json.dumps(books))

if __name__ == '__main__':
  url = "https://books.toscrape.com/catalogue/category/books/travel_2/index.html"
  scraper(url)
